result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad A Kizewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs due during period of supervision.
  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Submit to DNA sample and pay surcharge.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Chad A Kizewski in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reads ex-parte letter received. Victim is no longer requesting restitution. State gives recommendation. Court renders sentence.

ADDRESS INFO for Chad A Kizewski  PROVIDED BY USPS
Current: 2838 7th St., Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 02-15-2016)
Prior: 4885 Cth Ll,Bldg, Town Port Washington, WI 53074

Restitution hearing to be heard before sentencing. Defendant Chad A Kizewski in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim does not appear. Br 3 clerk  had advised the DA's office of a voice message earlier in the week from a caller identified as the victim stating unable to appear due to hospitalization. DA's office has not been able to contact the victim. Court will reschedule.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.

(Case called with co-defendant case 15CM599) Defendant Chad A Kizewski in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel have issue with restitution being requested.  Court sets matter over and gives deadline of 1/8/16 for any restitution submission by victims.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
No violent contact with co-defendant T.K.

Defendant Chad A Kizewski in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests adjournment for sentencing to review new restitution informaiton. Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Chad A Kizewski in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel provided update on status.  Further proceedings scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Chad A Kizewski in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requesting jury trial on this case with other case to track. Court will recall this case today at 1:15pm to set trial date. Co-def's case set for hearing today at that time,.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Chad A Kizewski in court with attorney Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel waives reading & enters a not guilty plea.  Court finds probable cause.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
8/13/15 hearing time moved to 10am at request of public defender.
